policy_summary: The license plate should likely stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold or transferred. The buyer must visit the MVD or an Authorized Third Party office to transfer the title and register the vehicle. This suggests the buyer requires a new registration, indicating that the license plate does not transfer with the vehicle.
dmv_excerpt: Upon sale or transfer of a vehicle, the registration for that vehicle is no longer valid. The buyer must visit any MVD or Authorized Third Party office to transfer the title and register the vehicle.
final_summary: The license plate should likely stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold or transferred. The buyer must visit the MVD or an Authorized Third Party office to transfer the title and register the vehicle. This suggests the buyer requires a new registration, indicating that the license plate does not transfer with the vehicle.
final_quote: Upon sale or transfer of a vehicle, the registration for that vehicle is no longer valid. The buyer must visit any MVD or Authorized Third Party office to transfer the title and register the vehicle.

policy_summary: The Arkansas DMV content does not cover whether the license plate stays with the owner or is transferred with the vehicle when sold. However, the content does state that the last titled owner(s) of record must sign the application form and that identification information for the vehicle, such as the license plate number, is required.
dmv_excerpt: Obtain the Last Titled Owner's Signature To apply for the replacement title, the vehicle owner must complete the Application for Title or Replacement Title. The last titled owner(s) of record must sign the application form... Vehicle Identification In addition to the above requirements, the applicant must provide identification information for the vehicle, such as a vehicle registration certificate, license plate number, title number, or vehicle identification number (VIN).
final_summary: The Arkansas DMV content does not cover whether the license plate stays with the owner or is transferred with the vehicle when sold. However, the content does state that the last titled owner(s) of record must sign the application form and that identification information for the vehicle, such as the license plate number, is required.
final_quote: Obtain the Last Titled Owner's Signature To apply for the replacement title, the vehicle owner must complete the Application for Title or Replacement Title. The last titled owner(s) of record must sign the application form... Vehicle Identification In addition to the above requirements, the applicant must provide identification information for the vehicle, such as a vehicle registration certificate, license plate number, title number, or vehicle identification number (VIN).

policy_summary: The license plate can be retained by the seller if they wish to use it on another vehicle they own. In the event when the vehicle does not have a license plate, such as when the seller retains their personalized plates for another vehicle, the buyer applies for Replacement Plates using form REG 156
dmv_excerpt: Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) A REG 156 (PDF) is used when the vehicle is missing a license plate or has no license plates, such as when the seller kept their personalized license plates for use on another vehicle owned by the seller.
source_url: Imaginary as text does not provide it
final_summary: The license plate can be retained by the seller if they wish to use it on another vehicle they own. In the event when the vehicle does not have a license plate, such as when the seller retains their personalized plates for another vehicle, the buyer applies for Replacement Plates using form REG 156
final_quote: Application for Replacement Plates, Stickers, Documents (REG 156) A REG 156 (PDF) is used when the vehicle is missing a license plate or has no license plates, such as when the seller kept their personalized license plates for use on another vehicle owned by the seller.

policy_summary: When selling a vehicle in Delaware, the license plate is expected to be removed by the seller, implying the plate stays with the owner and not transferred to the buyer.
dmv_excerpt: During and after the vehicle sale in Delaware, both parties involved in the transaction must adhere to legal obligations. These typically include disclosing the odometer, transferring the title, removing license plates, and notifying the DVM.
final_summary: When selling a vehicle in Delaware, the license plate is expected to be removed by the seller, implying the plate stays with the owner and not transferred to the buyer.
final_quote: During and after the vehicle sale in Delaware, both parties involved in the transaction must adhere to legal obligations. These typically include disclosing the odometer, transferring the title, removing license plates, and notifying the DVM.

policy_summary: In Florida, the license plate stays with the seller not the vehicle. The seller is required to remove the license plate from the vehicle when it is sold and can then transfer the plate to a new or replacement vehicle. If certain conditions apply, the seller must surrender the tag to a motor vehicle service center.
dmv_excerpt: Removing the Plates In a sale, license plates stay with seller not the vehicle. When motor vehicles are sold, the seller must remove the license plate from the vehicle and may then transfer the plate to a new or replacement vehicle. The seller must surrender the tag to a motor vehicle service center if:
final_summary: In Florida, the license plate stays with the seller not the vehicle. The seller is required to remove the license plate from the vehicle when it is sold and can then transfer the plate to a new or replacement vehicle. If certain conditions apply, the seller must surrender the tag to a motor vehicle service center.
final_quote: Removing the Plates In a sale, license plates stay with seller not the vehicle. policy_summary: In Indiana, the license plate is permitted to stay with the owner. It can be transferred from a vehicle that the seller owns or has sold/disposed of, to another vehicle that the owner owns or has newly acquired/purchased.
dmv_excerpt: Transfer a License Plate If you are completing any of the above transactions (new, renew, or amend a registration), you may also transfer a license plate from a vehicle that you own or have sold/disposed of to a different vehicle that you own or have newly acquired/purchased. Only the following license plates may be transferred online at mybmv.com: Passenger, Truck (11,000 pounds or less), Motorcycle, and In God We Trust, but please be advised that there may be specific scenarios where you cannot transfer online and must visit a branch to transfer your plate.
final_summary: In Indiana, the license plate is permitted to stay with the owner. It can be transferred from a vehicle that the seller owns or has sold/disposed of, to another vehicle that the owner owns or has newly acquired/purchased.
final_quote: Transfer a License Plate If you are completing any of the above transactions (new, renew, or amend a registration), you may also transfer a license plate from a vehicle that you own or have sold/disposed of to a different vehicle that you own or have newly acquired/purchased. Only the following license plates may be transferred online at mybmv.com: Passenger, Truck (11,000 pounds or less), Motorcycle, and In God We Trust, but please be advised that there may be specific scenarios where you cannot transfer online and must visit a branch to transfer your plate.

policy_summary: In Missouri, in some limited situations, the actual license plates may be transferred to the new vehicle without having to obtain new license plates. But generally, when no plates are available for transfer, a temporary permit may be purchased from the dealer.
dmv_excerpt: Obtaining a Temporary Permit Upon purchase of a newly acquired motor vehicle, trailer, or cycle, you may purchase a temporary permit from the dealer to operate the vehicle when no plates are available for transfer. (Missouri dealers can sell temporary permits to out-of-state residents only if they are purchasing motor vehicles, trailers, or cycles from their dealership). Transferring License Plates Credit of registration is available for many types of vehicle-to-vehicle registration transfers. And, in limited situations, the actual license plates may also be transferred to the new vehicle without having to obtain new license plates.
final_summary: In Missouri, in some limited situations, the actual license plates may be transferred to the new vehicle without having to obtain new license plates. But generally, when no plates are available for transfer, a temporary permit may be purchased from the dealer.
final_quote: Obtaining a Temporary Permit Upon purchase of a newly acquired motor vehicle, trailer, or cycle, you may purchase a temporary permit from the dealer to operate the vehicle when no plates are available for transfer. (Missouri dealers can sell temporary permits to out-of-state residents only if they are purchasing motor vehicles, trailers, or cycles from their dealership). Transferring License Plates Credit of registration is available for many types of vehicle-to-vehicle registration transfers. And, in limited situations, the actual license plates may also be transferred to the new vehicle without having to obtain new license plates.

policy_summary: In Montana, the license plates stay with the seller when a vehicle is sold. The seller is urged to not let the buyer drive the vehicle home with the plates as they would be liable for any parking or traffic violations that occur after the sale.
dmv_excerpt: Remove License Plates The plates belong to you, not the vehicle. Don’t let the buyer drive the vehicle home with the promise that they will return the plates. If you do not remove the plates, you may be liable for any parking or traffic violations that happen after the sale.
final_summary: In Montana, the license plates stay with the seller when a vehicle is sold. The seller is urged to not let the buyer drive the vehicle home with the plates as they would be liable for any parking or traffic violations that occur after the sale.
final_quote: Remove License Plates The plates belong to you, not the vehicle. Don’t let the buyer drive the vehicle home with the promise that they will return the plates. If you do not remove the plates, you may be liable for any parking or traffic violations that happen after the sale.

policy_summary: The content does not provide any explicit information or implication about whether the license plate should stay with the seller or be transferred to the buyer when the vehicle is sold.
In Nevada, the license plate should stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold. The seller must either keep the license plates or surrender them to the DMV within 30 days of the sale.
dmv_excerpt: When selling a vehicle it is important to notify the Nevada DMV that you no longer have possession of the car or truck. You may use theOnline Vehicle Resale Notificationto notify the DMV. The license plate for the car, truck or motorcycle must not be transferred to the new owner. You must either keep the license plates or surrender them to the DMV within 30 days of the sale.
final_summary: In Nevada, the license plate should stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold. The seller must either keep the license plates or surrender them to the DMV within 30 days of the sale.
final_quote: When selling a vehicle it is important to notify the Nevada DMV that you no longer have possession of the car or truck. You may use theOnline Vehicle Resale Notificationto notify the DMV. The license plate for the car, truck or motorcycle must not be transferred to the new owner. You must either keep the license plates or surrender them to the DMV within 30 days of the sale.

policy_summary: In New Hampshire, when a car is sold, the license plate must be removed by the seller and retained by them. The buyer is then responsible for registering the vehicle and obtaining new plates or transferring plates they already own.
dmv_excerpt: Selling a Car When you sell a car in New Hampshire, you must remove the license plates and keep them. The buyer is responsible for registering the vehicle and obtaining new license plates or transferring license plates they already own.
final_summary: In New Hampshire, when a car is sold, the license plate must be removed by the seller and retained by them. The buyer is then responsible for registering the vehicle and obtaining new plates or transferring plates they already own.
final_quote: Selling a Car When you sell a car in New Hampshire, you must remove the license plates and keep them. The buyer is responsible for registering the vehicle and obtaining new license plates or transferring license plates they already own.

policy_summary: The license plate in New Jersey can be transferred from the seller to the buyer if the vehicles are registered under the same name and both vehicles belong to the same vehicle class.
dmv_excerpt: Transferring plates When you change vehicles, you can transfer your plates to the new vehicle so long as the vehicle is registered in the same name as the previous vehicle and the vehicles are the same class, i.e. car to car, truck to truck.
final_summary: The license plate in New Jersey can be transferred from the seller to the buyer if the vehicles are registered under the same name and both vehicles belong to the same vehicle class.
final_quote: Transferring plates When you change vehicles, you can transfer your plates to the new vehicle so long as the vehicle is registered in the same name as the previous vehicle and the vehicles are the same class, i.e. car to car, truck to truck.

policy_summary: In New Mexico, the license plate stays with the owner and not the vehicle in case of a transaction such as sale or trade-in of the vehicle. Within 30 days from such a transaction, the owner should either get the plate destroyed or apply to have it assigned to another vehicle of the same class.
dmv_excerpt: New Mexico is a “Vehicle Plate to Owner” state. If the vehicle is sold, traded-in or given as a gift, the vehicle owner is responsible for removing the license plate from the vehicle. Within 30 days of the transaction, the vehicle owner shall take the plate to MVD to have it destroyed, or apply to have the plate assigned to another vehicle of the same class.
final_summary: In New Mexico, the license plate stays with the owner and not the vehicle in case of a transaction such as sale or trade-in of the vehicle. Within 30 days from such a transaction, the owner should either get the plate destroyed or apply to have it assigned to another vehicle of the same class.
final_quote: New Mexico is a “Vehicle Plate to Owner” state. If the vehicle is sold, traded-in or given as a gift, the vehicle owner is responsible for removing the license plate from the vehicle. Within 30 days of the transaction, the vehicle owner shall take the plate to MVD to have it destroyed, or apply to have the plate assigned to another vehicle of the same class.

policy_summary: The policy suggests that the license plate should be surrendered to the DMV when a vehicle is sold. This implies that the plate is not transferred to the new owner.

final_summary: The policy suggests that the license plate should be surrendered to the DMV when a vehicle is sold. This implies that the plate is not transferred to the new owner.

policy_summary: The license plate generally stays with the owner in North Carolina. However, in cases where a vehicle's owner dies, some specialty plates (e.g., military, disabled veteran, disability, etc.) may not be transferred.
dmv_excerpt: Transferring Plates to Another Vehicle...Transfer Fees A fee is required for license plate transfers except in the following cases when a vehicle is already titled in North Carolina when:...Restrictions In cases where a vehicle's owner dies, some specialty plates (e.g., military, disabled veteran, disability, etc.) cannot be transferred to surviving spouses since the plates carry eligibility requirements.
final_summary: The license plate generally stays with the owner in North Carolina. However, in cases where a vehicle's owner dies, some specialty plates (e.g., military, disabled veteran, disability, etc.) may not be transferred.
final_quote: Transferring Plates to Another Vehicle...Transfer Fees A fee is required for license plate transfers except in the following cases when a vehicle is already titled in North Carolina when:...Restrictions In cases where a vehicle's owner dies, some specialty plates (e.g., military, disabled veteran, disability, etc.) cannot be transferred to surviving spouses since the plates carry eligibility requirements.

policy_summary: In Ohio, the license plate should stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold. Ohio law requires the license plate to be removed and turned in to the local Ohio BMV unless it is to be transferred to another vehicle owned by the seller.
dmv_excerpt: Ohio law requires the license plate to be removed and turned in to your local Ohio BMV, unless you are transferring the plate to another vehicle. If you are not transferring the plate, you must submit form BMV 4311 Customer Request to Cancel Vehicle Registration.
final_summary: In Ohio, the license plate should stay with the seller when the vehicle is sold. Ohio law requires the license plate to be removed and turned in to the local Ohio BMV unless it is to be transferred to another vehicle owned by the seller.
final_quote: Ohio law requires the license plate to be removed and turned in to your local Ohio BMV, unless you are transferring the plate to another vehicle. If you are not transferring the plate, you must submit form BMV 4311 Customer Request to Cancel Vehicle Registration.

policy_summary: The owner has the option to keep the plates by deactivating them or to transfer the plates to a new vehicle using a License Plate Application (VSA 10). Old plates should be destroyed once replaced.
dmv_excerpt: You may temporarily deactivate your license plates and registration... Reactivate Plates You can easily reactivate your license plates and registration online... How to Transfer Plates Complete a License Plate Application (VSA 10)... What to Do with Old Plates Once you receive your new (replacement) plates, you may destroy the old plates.
final_summary: The owner has the option to keep the plates by deactivating them or to transfer the plates to a new vehicle using a License Plate Application (VSA 10). Old plates should be destroyed once replaced.
final_quote: You may temporarily deactivate your license plates and registration... Reactivate Plates You can easily reactivate your license plates and registration online... How to Transfer Plates Complete a License Plate Application (VSA 10)... What to Do with Old Plates Once you receive your new (replacement) plates, you may destroy the old plates.

policy_summary: The license plate should be transferred to the new vehicle owned by the same person, i.e., the plate stays with the owner. An address verification process is required for the transfer.
dmv_excerpt: When you transfer your license plates to another vehicle, you must verify your residence street address or business address with us
final_summary: The license plate should be transferred to the new vehicle owned by the same person, i.e., the plate stays with the owner. An address verification process is required for the transfer.
final_quote: When you transfer your license plates to another vehicle, you must verify your residence street address or business address with us

policy_summary: The content does not provide specific information on whether the license plate stays with the seller or is transferred to the buyer when the vehicle is sold in West Virginia. The details mostly revolve around titling a new vehicle, certificate of origin, new and used vehicle purchases, ATV's, gift transactions, trade-ins, titles and liens, lost/duplicate titles, and the procedure when a registrant dies. Overall, it focuses on the vehicle title rather than the license plates. Therefore, the policy regarding license plate transfer during vehicle sales remains uncertain based on the provided information.
